results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 1
results.brief_description:
The series follows two years in the life of village of Le Miroir and its residents as they go through the transformation of their quiet Alpine village into a modern skiing resort, Le Miroir 2000. The main protagonist is Antoine Sesterain, the mayor of the village and farmer. Antoine is a widower with three sons, all deeply attached to the mountains: Henri, a resort manager, Francois, a skiing instructor engaged to Martine and Pierre, a restless student. Pierre is causing havoc at the boarding school he attends in the valley and where his uncle, Abbe Bonnevie teaches. Following a prank, Pierre is denied permission to leave the school to attend his brother Henri’s wedding. During the wedding, Lauzon, a local saw-mill owner approaches Antoine with the idea of turning Le Miroir into a skiing resort. Set in the mid-1960s, ‘Les Sesterain’ is a realistic rendition of the changes many mountain villages had to go through as France sought to exploit the ‘white gold’ and the rising interest in winter sports.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga.

results.title: Les Mysteres de Paris (TV Version) = the Mysteries of Paris
results.brief_description:
This version of Sue’s novel was originally conceived as a live-to-air production. Rodolphe de Sombreuil runs over a poor man in the streets and promises he will look after his young daughter. Sombreuil disguises himself as a working-class man and goes looking for Fleur de Marie who has been kidnapped by shady underworld characters. He is appalled by the squalor in which people live in the depressing working class slums.

Credits: Director, Marcel Cravenne ; writers, Claude Santelli ; photography, Maurice Barry ; music, Maurice Jarre.
Cast: Clotilde Joano, Marcel Bozzuffi, Jacques Dacqmine, Edmond Beauchamp, Georgette Anys, Jacques Marin, Francois Chaumette, Denise Gence, Veronique Silver, Maria Mauban, Claude Pieplu, Francois Maistre, Maria Meriko, Victor Lanoux, Clara Daquin.

results.title: Les Maitres du Temps = the Time Masters
results.creator_credit: Rene Laloux, Jacques Dercourt and Roland Gritti
results.brief_description:
His name is Piel. He is four years old. He is the last survivor of planet Perdide. How could he outsmart the dangers of a planet that has already claimed the lives of his parents and recognise the poisonous fruits and the venimous flowers? His last link with the world of humans is a radio transmitter whose distress signals have been received by Grand Max, a traveller with a generous heart. Max uses the radio to keep watch on the orphan while trying to organise a rescue mission. Stephan Wul (born 1922) is one of the pioneers of French science-fiction writing. Jean Giraud, by the name of Moebius, revolutionised the universe of fictional comics, creating a special and magical atmosphere around his stories. He is credited with inspiring the visual imagery of works such as ‘Blade Runner’ and ‘The Fifth Element’. Further reading: Gianalberto Bendazzi. ‘Rene Laloux. Drawings That Move’. Animation World: April 1996 (Vol. 1, No.1). Online. http://www.awn.com/mag/issue1.1/

Credits: Producers, Roland Gritti, Jacques Dercourt ; director, Rene Laloux ; writers, Rene Laloux, Moebius (Jean Giraud), Jean-Patrick Manchette ; photography, Mihaly Kovacs, Andras Klausz, Zoltan Basco, Arpad Lossonczy ; music, Jean-Pierre Bourtayre
Cast: Sady Rebbot, Frederic Legros, Jean Valmont, Yves Marie, Pierre Tourneur, Alain Cuny [voices only].

results.title: Les Honneurs de la Guerre = the Honours of War
results.brief_description:
Nanteuil, 1944. The joy of the impending liberation is stopped by the arrival of a group of German soldiers. They have no murderous intent, in spite of the exhortations of one of their officers. They just want to make a deal: they will lock the population in the church and wait for the arrival of the US army to whom they want to surrender without fighting. During the wait in the church, the tension between the villagers rises, slowly entertained by a French fascist, to the point where bloodshed seems inevitable. For attempting to break the traditional image of the Resistance, this film was held on the shelves for two years and released only in February 1962

Credits: Producer, Daniel Muller ; director, Jean Dewever ; writer, Jean-Charles Tacchella ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet.
Cast: Pierre Collet, Paul Mercey, Henri Maik, Danielle Godet, Alix Mahieux, Bernard Verley.

results.title: Les Fruits Amers = Bitter Fruits
results.creator_credit: Colette Audry, Jacqueline Audry, Guy Perol and Raymond Froment
results.brief_description:
Soledad is a member of a revolutionary group in South America. When she is arrested by government agents, she owes her release to her sister who is having an affair with the local police chief.

Credits: Producers, Raymond Froment, Guy Perol ; directors, Jacqueline Audry, Colette Audry ; writer, Colette Audry ; photography, Maurice Fellous ; music, Joseph Kosma.
Cast: Laurent Terzieff, Emmanuelle Riva, Beba Loncar, Roger Coggio, Rick Battaglia.
